Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, great Location The Ganivet is 10 minutes from Plaza Mayor. The staff are very nice. price is low for that kind of hotel.
Reviews.Author: Dan11116

Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, close to major attractions of Madrid       Hotel Ganivet - View from our room
Reviews.Author: Bloomnormal

Reviews.Content: Spain holiday with Gate1 travel - Hotel Gavinet We have just returned from a 4 days inHotel Gavinet. The hotel is 3 stars, but I would rate it 4+.The location is walking distance from the center of the city, so we never took the cab. Breakfast was included and was great. Rooms a very clean and good size. Front desk was very helpfull. The only minus is that there is not enough information about different tours and excursions at the front desk. Actually we booked our trip through GATE1 Travel web site. It was my first experience with them. It was exellent - the price, acommodation, airfair - everything!!! I will use it again and recommend all my friends.
Reviews.Author: Magic90

Reviews.Content: Good hotel in city center My girlfried and I were in Madrid for 5 days in June 2008 and stayed at Ganivet. We found it to be a solid, reasonable 3-star hotel in the city center. The location is not in the dead center of the city, however it's only 15 minute walk from Plaza Mayor, in a nice and relativety quiet neighborhood, metro is just two steps away. Puerta de Atocha train station also easily reachable by bus (line C2), which was important for us. The room was of adequate size, furniture nice, bathroom clean and modern. The buffet breakfast was very nice, good variety and quality of food. Check-in was quick and hassle-free. The reception staff spoke English and overall were nice. The hotel has free wi-fi in rooms, very convenient.The room had a nice flat-screen TV, but unfortunately only few channels were available and for some reason the picture quality was bad to the point of unusable. This is a minor complaint, as watching TV was not our primary goal in Madrid :-).I readily recommend this hotel as a very reasonable place to stay in Madrid city center for sightseeing of business.
Reviews.Author: Leonid

Reviews.Content: This Hotel was Great ! Me and my partner had a four day trip to Madrid in July of this year. We were wary of city centre hotels abroad as we booked for Rome last year and ended up miles out of the city !!!. Not this time. The Ganivet was roughly 10 mins walk from the City Centre with a Metro stop literally at the bottom of the road. It was fantastic location. Not too far out but far enough out from the hustle and bustle of city life as Madrid is extremely busy. If you caught the open top tour bus again, this stopped at the bottom of the road. We were pleasantly suprised when we opened the door to find a clean, air conditioned room, which was very modern and had excellent facilities and clean towels on a daily basis. The bathroom was really well equipped with an excellent power shower. I would say this is top end 3*. We could not review the breakfast however because we eat out every day. I would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to anyone and were certainly return here if we ever went back to Madrid....!!!
Reviews.Author: Collier886

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel as well as location       Ganivet Hotel
Reviews.Author: russ6212

Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel       Looking towards bathroom
Reviews.Author: Heclsm78

Reviews.Content: Great hotel We've just returned from a 4 day trip to Madrid and we loved this hotel. i would rate it as Excellent if it wasn't the fact that we booked a triple room and the room became too small for 3adults. But as a double, the space is more than enough. the bathroom is okay. the location is great, near Puerta de Toledo, with bus and metro but we walk all the time. the hotel is central but for some atractions like las ventas, santiago bernabeu, only metro or bus. The hotel is so close to the Palacio Real and Catedral de Almudena. i would recommend it without any doubt.
Reviews.Author: lisbonsoul

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Stay Really great hotel in a central location very close to the Toledo metro stop. The hotel is not as it may appear on many websites as it has had a full re-fit last year and is really rather nice (some sites have some very old photos which no longer apply as the Ganivet is now under the ownership of Porcel Hotels) The place seems to have been completely gutted and refurbished from the floor up. The facade has also been re-rendered together with the bank alongside it.The beds were very comfortable, the shower was powerful and the bath comfortable. The windows are now double glazed and we didn't hear anything from the road at any time during our stay. Our room was climate controlled, had an LCD television and a safe. The fixtures and fittings are of a high quality.The Ganivet provided a very pleasant environment to stay in and was largely at the top end of 3 stars. Breakfast was acceptable but sometimes a little warm instead of hot which we mentioned on our departure. There is a lack of local restaurants, unless you want something along the lines of Tapas or very traditional food. You'd need to jump on the Metro two stops to Opera and wander up the Calle de Arenal to find a great selection of restaurants.We stayed for three nights, the reception staff were very efficient, the lift wasn't a problem at all as other reviewers have noted. All in all, a trouble free stay in an excellent standard of accommodation which we got at a very good rate. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: Dorian_Gray1986

Reviews.Content: Loved it Excellent value for money. Great Location (1 km from Plaza Mayor), very clean (bed and bath). Perfect 2 * hotel.Lift does not always work -- that is the only downside.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Not a good hotel Not a good hotel. Ok it is a 2 star, but it is not clean (found hair in my bed sheets), an scaring elevator, which sometimes was not working, and poor furniture. Heating system was not enough and the room was cold. Also not very good breakfast. The only good things were the staff and the location. I would rather stay in a hotel not so well located, but maybe close to the metro, and pay the same for a better place. Would not stay here again and not recommend it.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great place, but bring earplugs Excellent staff, location and price. Great spit and sawdust tapas bar opposite too, especially if you like your snails curried. Only quibble is that the building is showing its age (i.e. 1950s) and its acoustics are typical. The tiled corridors echo through thin doors and plumbing can generate white noise of an alarming intensity.
Reviews.Author: fremsley

Reviews.Content: Clean, basic  I stayed in the Finesterre twice with a few months. Once for three nights last September on a girlie long weekend and again in March on a long weekend with my mother.The hotel is clean but basic. Not very sound proof so the inconsiderate guests arriving back in the early hours of the morning kept waking us up.Ideal location for all tourist attractions. Unfortunately, no bar, which means you can't meander back and have a quiet night cap before retiring. That is my only complaint.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay We just returned froma trip to Europe. We'd stayed for 19 nights at the Finisterre and greatly enjoyed it. The room was simple but comfortable, although the bathroom can use some form of ventilation. The provision of a clothes iron would also would had been useful.The staff were wonderful, both the cafeteria and cleaning staff. Location can't be beat from my point of view.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Tourist hotel A really good tourist hotel. conveniently situated and friendly. Bedrooms etc are basic but clean and everything works. Excellent location within easy walking distance of the city centre and the main attractions although the metro station is just around the corner. Good value.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: best 2 star This a great 2 star hotel. Walking didstance to Royal Place and the Plaza Major and the metro is 2-3 blocks away. Coffee shops and supermarket in vicinity. Rooms are immaculate clean but basic. breakfast was sufficient. Chinese restaurant nearby but order vegetarian. Small lift. Hotel is on a high traffic street but the noise didn't bother us. Where is it quiet in Madrid? Radiators work, I dried my clothes on them.
Reviews.Author: fairytail
